pokedex_entries.gold: Its tail is so powerful that it can use it to grab a tree branch and hold itself up in the air.
pokedex_entries.silver: It lives atop tall trees. When leaping from branch to branch, it deftly uses its tail for balance.
pokedex_entries.crystal: It uses its tail to hang on to tree branches. It uses its momentum to swing from one branch to another.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: AIPOM’s tail ends in a hand-like appendage that can be cleverly manipulated. However, because the POKéMON uses its tail so much, its real hands have become rather clumsy.
pokedex_entries.firered: It lives atop tall trees. When leaping from branch to branch, it deftly uses its tail for balance.
pokedex_entries.leafgreen: Its tail is so powerful that it can use it to grab a tree branch and hold itself up in the air.
pokedex_entries.emerald: Its tail ends with a dexterous, handlike appendage. However, because it uses the tail so much, AIPOM’s real hands have become rather clumsy.
pokedex_entries.diamond: It uses its tail to pluck fruits that are out of reach. Its tail is more adept than its real hands.
pokedex_entries.pearl: It lives atop giant trees. It wraps its tail around a branch so it won’t fall off while asleep.
pokedex_entries.platinum: It lives high among the treetops. It can use its tail as freely and cleverly as its hands.
pokedex_entries.heartgold: Its tail is so powerful that it can use it to grab a tree branch and hold itself up in the air.

pokedex_entries.omega_rubyalpha_sapphire: Aipom’s tail ends in a hand-like appendage that can be cleverly manipulated. However, because the Pokémon uses its tail so much, its real hands have become rather clumsy.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: As it did more and more with its tail, its hands became clumsy. It makes its nest high in the treetops.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It searches for prey from the tops of trees. When it spots its favorite food, Bounsweet, Aipom gets excited and pounces.

pokedex_entries.shining_pearl: It lives atop giant trees. It wraps its tail around a branch so it won’t fall off while asleep.
pokedex_entries.legends:_arceus: This treetop dweller possesses a tail as dexterous as a hand. Ancient writings describe this Pokémon as a one-armed oddity.

pokedex_entries.gold: The tail’s tip shines brightly and can be seen from far away. It acts as a beacon for lost people.
pokedex_entries.silver: The bright light on its tail can be seen far away. It has been treasured since ancient times as a beacon.
pokedex_entries.crystal: When it gets dark, the light from its bright, shiny tail can be seen from far away on the ocean’s surface.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: AMPHAROS gives off so much light that it can be seen even from space. People in the old days used the light of this POKéMON to send signals back and forth with others far away.

pokedex_entries.gold: It spins string not only from its rear but also from its mouth. It is hard to tell which end is which.
pokedex_entries.silver: A single strand of a special string is endlessly spun out of its rear. The string leads back to its nest.
pokedex_entries.crystal: Rather than making a nest in one specific spot, it wanders in search of food after darkness falls.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: ARIADOS’s feet are tipped with tiny hooked claws that enable it to scuttle on ceilings and vertical walls. This POKéMON constricts the foe with thin and strong silk webbing.

pokedex_entries.gold: By keeping still and listening intently, it can tell what is in even wild, fast-moving rivers.
pokedex_entries.silver: When it plays in water, it rolls up its elongated ears to prevent their insides from getting wet.
pokedex_entries.crystal: The bubble-like pattern on its stomach helps it camouflage itself when it’s in the water.
pokedex_entries.ruby: AZUMARILL’s long ears are indispensable sensors. By focusing its hearing, this POKéMON can identify what kinds of prey are around, even in rough and fast-running rivers.
pokedex_entries.sapphire: AZUMARILL can make balloons out of air. It makes these air balloons if it spots a drowning POKéMON. The air balloons enable the POKéMON in trouble to breathe.
pokedex_entries.firered: When it plays in water, it rolls up its elongated ears to prevent their insides from getting wet.
pokedex_entries.leafgreen: By keeping still and listening intently, it can even tell what is in wild, fast-moving rivers.
pokedex_entries.emerald: It lives in water virtually all day long. Its body color and pattern act as camouflage that makes it tough for enemies to spot in water.
pokedex_entries.diamond: It lives in rivers and lakes. In water, its coloring and patterns trick the vision of foes.
pokedex_entries.pearl: Its long ears are superb sensors. It can distinguish the movements of living things on riverbeds.
pokedex_entries.platinum: It can spend all day in water, since it can inhale and store a large volume of air.

pokedex_entries.sword: It spends most of its time in the water. On sunny days, Azumarill floats on the surface of the water and sunbathes.
pokedex_entries.shield: These Pokémon create air-filled bubbles. When Azurill play in rivers, Azumarill will cover them with these bubbles.

pokedex_entries.gold: The scent of spices comes from around its neck. Somehow, sniffing it makes you want to fight.

pokedex_entries.crystal: The scent that wafts from the leaves on its neck causes anyone who smells it to become energetic.

pokedex_entries.gold: BELLOSSOM gather at times and appear to dance. They say that the dance is a ritual to summon the sun.
pokedex_entries.silver: Plentiful in the tropics. When it dances, its petals rub together and make a pleasant ringing sound.
pokedex_entries.crystal: When these dance together, their petals rub against each other, making pretty, relaxing sounds.
pokedex_entries.ruby: When BELLOSSOM gets exposed to plenty of sunlight, the leaves ringing its body begin to spin around. This POKéMON’s dancing is renowned in the southern lands.
pokedex_entries.sapphire: A BELLOSSOM grows flowers more beautifully if it has evolved from a smelly GLOOM - the stinkier the better. At night, this POKéMON closes its petals and goes to sleep.
pokedex_entries.firered: Plentiful in the tropics. When it dances, its petals rub together and make a pleasant ringing sound.

pokedex_entries.emerald: Its flower petals deepen in color through exposure to sunlight. When cloudy weather persists, it does a dance that is thought to be a ritual for summoning the sun.
pokedex_entries.diamondpearlplatinum: When the heavy rainfall season ends, it is drawn out by warm sunlight to dance in the open.

pokedex_entries.gold: Anyone who takes even one bite of BLISSEY’s egg becomes unfailingly caring and pleasant to everyone.
pokedex_entries.silver: It has a very compassionate nature. If it sees a sick POKéMON, it will nurse the sufferer back to health.
pokedex_entries.crystal: Biting into one of the delicious eggs that BLISSEY provides will make everyone around smile with joy.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: BLISSEY senses sadness with its fluffy coat of fur. If it does so, this POKéMON will rush over to the sad person, however far they may be, to share an egg of happiness that brings a smile to any face.
pokedex_entries.firered: It has a very compassionate nature. If it sees a sick POKéMON, it will nurse the sufferer back to health.

pokedex_entries.emerald: If it senses sadness with its fluffy fur, a BLISSEY will rush over to the sad person, however far away, to share an egg of happiness that brings a smile to any face.
pokedex_entries.diamond: This kindhearted Pokémon nurses sick Pokémon to health. It senses feelings of sadness.
pokedex_entries.pearl: It is a Pokémon that delivers happiness. Eating its egg is said to make one kind to everyone.
pokedex_entries.platinum: The eggs it lays are filled with happiness. Eating even one bite will bring a smile to anyone.

pokedex_entries.omega_rubyalpha_sapphire: Blissey senses sadness with its fluffy coat of fur. If it does so, this Pokémon will rush over to a sad person, no matter how far away, to share a Lucky Egg that brings a smile to any face.
pokedex_entries.sun: Even the most ferocious Pokémon become calm when they eat Blissey’s egg, which is said to be filled with happiness.
pokedex_entries.moon: Its fluffy fur coat acts as a sensor, enabling it to read the feelings of people and Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Their eggs are such a delicacy that some say eating one will bring you happiness. These eggs fetch the highest prices on the market.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: This Pokémon is overflowing with love. Only Chansey that share a strong bond with their Trainer can evolve, so people say.
pokedex_entries.sword: Whenever a Blissey finds a weakened Pokémon, it will share its egg and offer its care until the other Pokémon is all better.
pokedex_entries.shield: Blissey lays mysterious eggs that are filled with happiness. It’s said that anyone who eats a Blissey egg will start acting kindly to all others.
pokedex_entries.brilliant_diamond: This kindhearted Pokémon nurses sick Pokémon to health. It senses feelings of sadness.
pokedex_entries.shining_pearl: It is a Pokémon that delivers happiness. Eating its egg is said to make one kind to everyone.
pokedex_entries.legends:_arceus: A kindhearted Pokémon that will care for any sick person or Pokémon until their health improves. The eggs it lays are delicious and bring good fortune to those who eat them.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Anyone who takes even one taste of Blissey’s egg becomes unfailingly caring and pleasant to everyone.
pokedex_entries.violet: The eggs it lays are filled with happiness. Eating even one bite will bring a smile to anyone.

pokedex_entries.silver: When CELEBI disappears deep in a forest, it is said to leave behind an egg it brought from the future.
pokedex_entries.crystal: Revered as a guardian of the forest, CELEBI appears wherever beautiful forests exist.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphireemerald: This POKéMON came from the future by crossing over time. It is thought that so long as CELEBI appears, a bright and shining future awaits us.

pokedex_entries.gold: It shoots positive and negative electricity between the tips of its two antennae and zaps its enemies.
pokedex_entries.silver: On the dark ocean floor, its only means of communication is its constantly flashing lights.
pokedex_entries.crystal: Its antennae, which evolved from a fin, have both positive and negative charges flowing through them.
pokedex_entries.ruby: CHINCHOU lets loose positive and negative electrical charges from its two antennas to make its prey faint. This POKéMON flashes its electric lights to exchange signals with others.
pokedex_entries.sapphire: CHINCHOU’s two antennas are filled with cells that generate strong electricity. This POKéMON’s cells create so much electrical power, it even makes itself tingle slightly.

pokedex_entries.emerald: When it senses danger, it discharges positive and negative electricity from its two antennae. It lives in depths beyond sunlight’s reach.

pokedex_entries.sun: Its two antennae were originally fins. It discharges electricity to stun its prey before attacking.
pokedex_entries.moon: It lives in the depths beyond the reach of sunlight. It flashes lights on its antennae to communicate with others of its kind.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Its two antennae glow softly to lure in prey, making it a useful Pokémon for night fishing.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Chinchou blink their shining antennae at one another to claim their respective turf.
pokedex_entries.sword: Its antennae, which evolved from a fin, have both positive and negative charges flowing through them.
pokedex_entries.shield: On the dark ocean floor, its only means of communication is its constantly flashing lights.
pokedex_entries.brilliant_diamondshining_pearl: It discharges positive and negative electricity from the tips of its antennae to shock its foes.

pokedex_entries.gold: Because of its unusual, star-like silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.
pokedex_entries.silver: When numerous meteors illuminate the night sky, sightings of CLEFFA strangely increase.
pokedex_entries.crystal: If the impact site of a meteorite is found, this POKéMON is certain to be within the immediate area.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: On nights with many shooting stars, CLEFFA can be seen dancing in a ring. They dance through the night and stop only at the break of day, when these POKéMON quench their thirst with the morning dew.
pokedex_entries.firered: When numerous meteors illuminate the night sky, sightings of CLEFFA strangely increase.
pokedex_entries.leafgreen: Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.
pokedex_entries.emerald: On nights with many shooting stars, CLEFFA can be seen dancing in a ring. They dance until daybreak, when they quench their thirst with the morning dew.
pokedex_entries.diamond: Its silhouette is like a star. It is believed to arrive riding on shooting stars.
pokedex_entries.pearl: Many appear when the night skies are filled with shooting stars. They disappear with sunrise.
pokedex_entries.platinum: It is often seen when shooting stars fill the night skies. It’s said to arrive riding on a shooting star.
pokedex_entries.heartgold: Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.
pokedex_entries.soulsilver: When numerous meteors illuminate the night sky, sightings of CLEFFA strangely increase.
pokedex_entries.blackwhite: It is often seen when shooting stars fill the night skies. It’s said to arrive riding on a shooting star.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: According to local rumors, Cleffa are often seen in places where shooting stars have fallen.
pokedex_entries.x: Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.
pokedex_entries.y: Many appear when the night skies are filled with shooting stars. They disappear with sunrise.
pokedex_entries.omega_rubyalpha_sapphire: On nights with many shooting stars, Cleffa can be seen dancing in a ring. They dance through the night and stop only at the break of day, when these Pokémon quench their thirst with the morning dew.
pokedex_entries.sun: On late nights illuminated by shooting stars, it gazes intently skyward, as if thinking of its home.
pokedex_entries.moon: Because of its silhouette, it’s believed to be a star reborn. For some reason, it loves Minior.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: On nights with many shooting stars, they gather in packs and dance in circles. If you should see them, something good will happen!
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Said to have ridden here on a shooting star, Cleffa seem to appear in places where meteorites have struck in the past.
pokedex_entries.sword: According to local rumors, Cleffa are often seen in places where shooting stars have fallen.
pokedex_entries.shield: Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.
pokedex_entries.brilliant_diamond: Its silhouette is like a star. It is believed to arrive riding on shooting stars.
pokedex_entries.shining_pearl: Many appear when the night skies are filled with shooting stars. They disappear with sunrise.
pokedex_entries.legends:_arceus: In silhouette, they resemble twinkling starlight. When shooting stars rain from the night sky, Cleffa gather in numbers and dance as though they are indeed incarnations of the stars.

pokedex_entries.gold: It continuously sheds and grows. The tip of its head is prized as a treasure for its beauty.
pokedex_entries.silver: In a south sea nation, the people live in communities that are built on groups of these POKéMON.
pokedex_entries.crystal: The points on its head absorb nutrients from clean water. They cannot survive in polluted water.
pokedex_entries.ruby: CORSOLA’s branches glitter very beautifully in seven colors when they catch sunlight. If any branch breaks off, this POKéMON grows it back in just one night.
pokedex_entries.sapphire: Clusters of CORSOLA congregate in warm seas where they serve as ideal hiding places for smaller POKéMON. When the water temperature falls, this POKéMON migrates to the southern seas.
pokedex_entries.firered: In a south sea nation, the people live in communities that are built on groups of these POKéMON.
pokedex_entries.leafgreen: It continuously sheds and grows. The tip of its head is prized as a treasure for its beauty.
pokedex_entries.emerald: CORSOLA live in warm southern seas. If the sea becomes polluted, the beautiful coral stalks become discolored and crumble away in tatters.
pokedex_entries.diamondpearlplatinum: Many live in the clean seas of the south. They apparently can’t live in polluted waters.
pokedex_entries.heartgold: It continuously sheds and grows. The tip of its head is prized as a treasure because of its beauty.
pokedex_entries.soulsilver: In a south-sea nation, the people live in communities that are built on groups of these Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.blackwhite: Many live in the clean seas of the south. They apparently can’t live in polluted waters.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: They prefer unpolluted southern seas. Their coral branches lose their color and deteriorate in dirty water.
pokedex_entries.x: It continuously sheds and grows. The tip of its head is prized as a treasure because of its beauty.
pokedex_entries.y: They prefer unpolluted southern seas. Their coral branches lose their color and deteriorate in dirty water.
pokedex_entries.omega_ruby: Corsola’s branches glitter very beautifully in seven colors when they catch sunlight. If any branch breaks off, this Pokémon grows it back in just one night.
pokedex_entries.alpha_sapphire: Clusters of Corsola congregate in warm seas where they serve as ideal hiding places for smaller Pokémon. When the water temperature falls, this Pokémon migrates to the southern seas.
pokedex_entries.sun: Coral branches grow from its head. They break off quite easily, but they grow back in about three days.
pokedex_entries.moon: Pursued by Mareanie for the branches on its head, this Pokémon will sometimes snap its own branches off as a diversion while it escapes.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: The pink of Corsola that live in Alola is deep and vibrant, thanks to seas filled with nutrition.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: In Alola, where their natural enemies Mareanie are plentiful, many Corsola have stubby branches on their heads.
pokedex_entries.sword: It will regrow any branches that break off its head. People keep particularly beautiful Corsola branches as charms to promote safe childbirth.
pokedex_entries.shield: These Pokémon live in warm seas. In prehistoric times, many lived in the oceans around the Galar region as well.
pokedex_entries.brilliant_diamondshining_pearl: Many live in the clean seas of the south. They apparently can’t live in polluted waters.

pokedex_entries.gold: It flies so silently through the dark on its four wings that it may not be noticed even when nearby.
pokedex_entries.silver: The development of wings on its legs enables it to fly fast but also makes it tough to stop and rest.
pokedex_entries.crystal: As a result of its pursuit of faster, yet more silent flight, a new set of wings grew on its hind legs.
pokedex_entries.ruby: If this POKéMON is flying by fluttering only a pair of wings on either the forelegs or hind legs, it’s proof that CROBAT has been flying a long distance. It switches the wings it uses if it is tired.
pokedex_entries.sapphire: CROBAT sneaks up on its intended prey using wings that barely make a sound. This POKéMON rests by hanging on a tree branch with its rear legs that serve as wings.
pokedex_entries.firered: The development of wings on its legs enables it to fly fast but also makes it tough to stop and rest.
pokedex_entries.leafgreen: It flies so silently through the dark on its four wings that it may not be noticed even when nearby.
pokedex_entries.emerald: Over the course of evolution, its hind legs turned into wings. By alternately resting its front and rear wings, it can fly all day without having to stop.
pokedex_entries.diamond: Having four wings enables it to fly faster and more quietly. It turns active when the night comes.
pokedex_entries.pearl: A Pokémon that gained vastly enhanced flying performance by having its legs turn into wings.
pokedex_entries.platinum: The transformation of its legs into wings made it better at flying, but more clumsy at walking.
pokedex_entries.heartgold: It flies so silently through the dark on its four wings that it may not be noticed even when nearby.
pokedex_entries.soulsilver: The development of wings on its legs enables it to fly fast but also makes it tough to stop and rest.
pokedex_entries.blackwhite: The transformation of its legs into wings made it better at flying, but more clumsy at walking.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Having four wings allows it to fly more quickly and quietly so it can sneak up on prey without its noticing.
pokedex_entries.x: It flies so silently through the dark on its four wings that it may not be noticed even when nearby.
pokedex_entries.y: Having four wings allows it to fly more quickly and quietly so it can sneak up on prey without its noticing.
pokedex_entries.omega_ruby: If this Pokémon is flying by fluttering only a pair of wings on either the forelegs or hind legs, it’s proof that Crobat has been flying a long distance. It switches the wings it uses if it is tired.
pokedex_entries.alpha_sapphire: Crobat sneaks up on its intended prey using wings that barely make a sound. This Pokémon rests by hanging on a tree branch with its rear legs that serve as wings.
pokedex_entries.sun: Both its legs became wings, and as a result, it can’t move well on the ground. All it can do is crawl around.
pokedex_entries.moon: Silent and swift in its four-winged flight, it bites down on its prey before they realize what’s happening. In a heartbeat, it drains their blood.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Its fangs are so sharp, if it bites you in the dark and sucks your blood, you won’t notice any pain or realize you’ve been bitten.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It feeds on the blood of living people and Pokémon. If it can’t drink any blood for even a short while, it becomes weak and unable to fly.
pokedex_entries.sword: Both of its legs have turned into wings. Without a sound, Crobat flies swiftly toward its prey and sinks its fangs into the nape of its target’s neck.
pokedex_entries.shield: This Pokémon flaps its four wings skillfully. Crobat can fly through cramped caves without needing to slow down.
pokedex_entries.brilliant_diamond: Having four wings enables it to fly faster and more quietly. It turns active when the night comes.
pokedex_entries.shining_pearl: This Pokémon gained vastly enhanced flying capabilities after its legs became wings.
pokedex_entries.legends:_arceus: Its hind limbs have become another set of wings. Crobat expertly maneuvers its four wings to dart in exquisite fashion through even the most confined caves without losing any speed.

pokedex_entries.silver: It opens its huge jaws wide when attacking. If it loses any fangs while biting, they grow back in.
pokedex_entries.crystal: The tips of its fangs are slanted backward. Once those fangs clamp down, the prey has no hope of escape.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: Once CROCONAW has clamped its jaws on its foe, it will absolutely not let go. Because the tips of its fangs are forked back like barbed fishhooks, they become impossible to remove when they have sunk in.

pokedex_entries.gold: It is timid, and always curls itself up in a ball. If attacked, it flares up its back for protection.
pokedex_entries.silver: It usually stays hunched over. If it is angry or surprised, it shoots flames out of its back.
pokedex_entries.crystal: The fire that spouts from its back burns hottest when it is angry. The flaring flames intimidate foes.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: CYNDAQUIL protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back. The flames are vigorous if the POKéMON is angry. However, if it is tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.

pokedex_entries.leafgreen: It is timid and always curls itself up in a ball. If attacked, it flares up its back for protection.
pokedex_entries.emerald: It flares flames from its back to protect itself. The fire burns vigorously if the POKéMON is angry. When it is tired, it sputters with incomplete combustion.
pokedex_entries.diamondpearlplatinum: It has a timid nature. If it is startled, the flames on its back burn more vigorously.
pokedex_entries.heartgold: It is timid, and always curls itself up in a ball. If attacked, it flares up its back for protection.

pokedex_entries.gold: It carries food all day long. There are tales about lost people who were saved by the food it had.
pokedex_entries.silver: It nests at the edge of sharp cliffs. It spends all day carrying food to its awaiting chicks.
pokedex_entries.crystal: It always carries its food with it, wherever it goes. If attacked, it throws its food at the opponent.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: DELIBIRD carries its food bundled up in its tail. There once was a famous explorer who managed to reach the peak of Mt. Everest thanks to one of these POKéMON sharing its food.

pokedex_entries.emerald: It carries food bundled up in its tail. There was a famous explorer who managed to scale Mt. Everest thanks to a DELIBIRD sharing its food.
pokedex_entries.diamondpearlplatinum: It carries food rolled up in its tail. It has the habit of sharing food with people lost in mountains.

pokedex_entries.y: It carries food all day long. When someone is lost in the mountains, it shares that food.
pokedex_entries.omega_rubyalpha_sapphire: Delibird carries its food bundled up in its tail. There once was a famous explorer who managed to reach the peak of the world’s highest mountain, thanks to one of these Pokémon sharing its food.
pokedex_entries.sun: Although it naturally prefers colder locales, Delibird in Alola seem able to withstand the heat to a certain extent.
pokedex_entries.moon: It has a generous habit of sharing its food with people and Pokémon, so it’s always scrounging around for more food.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It shares its food with people who are stranded. Because Delibird is omnivorous, sometimes it gives those people bug Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It wraps food in its tail to carry it around. The Delibird with the biggest tail is the boss of the flock!

pokedex_entries.gold: It has sharp, hard tusks and a rugged hide. Its TACKLE is strong enough to knock down a house.
pokedex_entries.silver: The longer and bigger its tusks, the higher its rank in its herd. The tusks take long to grow.
pokedex_entries.crystal: Because this POKéMON’s skin is so tough, a normal attack won’t even leave a scratch on it.
pokedex_entries.ruby: DONPHAN’s favorite attack is curling its body into a ball, then charging at its foe while rolling at high speed. Once it starts rolling, this POKéMON can’t stop very easily.
pokedex_entries.sapphire: If DONPHAN were to tackle with its hard body, even a house could be destroyed. Using its massive strength, the POKéMON helps clear rock and mud slides that block mountain trails.
pokedex_entries.firered: The longer and bigger its tusks, the higher its rank in its herd. The tusks take a long time to grow.
pokedex_entries.leafgreen: It has sharp, hard tusks and a rugged hide. Its TACKLE is strong enough to knock down a house.
pokedex_entries.emerald: A DONPHAN is so strong it can easily haul a dump truck. Its hide has toughened to a rock-hard state. An ordinary sort of attack won’t even leave a scratch.
pokedex_entries.diamondpearlplatinum: It attacks by curling up, then rolling into its foe. It can blow apart a house in one hit.
pokedex_entries.heartgold: It has sharp, hard tusks and a rugged hide. Its tackle is strong enough to knock down a house.

pokedex_entries.brilliant_diamondshining_pearl: It attacks by curling up and rolling into its foe. It can blow apart a house in one hit.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Donphan is covered in tough hide, so even being hit by a car won’t faze this Pokémon. However, it is extremely susceptible to rain.
pokedex_entries.violet: Donphan is normally a calm Pokémon, but once it is enraged, it will curl its body into a ball and charge at you while rolling.

pokedex_entries.gold: When spotted, this POKéMON escapes backward by furiously boring into the ground with its tail.
pokedex_entries.silver: If spotted, it escapes by burrowing with its tail. It can float just slightly using its wings.
pokedex_entries.crystal: It hides deep inside caves where no light ever reaches it and remains virtually motionless there.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: DUNSPARCE has a drill for its tail. It uses this tail to burrow into the ground backwards. This POKéMON is known to make its nest in complex shapes deep under the ground.
pokedex_entries.firered: If spotted, it escapes by burrowing with its tail. It can hover just slightly using its wings.
pokedex_entries.leafgreen: When spotted, this POKéMON escapes backward by furiously boring into the ground with its tail.
pokedex_entries.emerald: Its drill-tipped tail is used to burrow into the ground backwards. This POKéMON is known to make its nest in complex shapes deep under the ground.
pokedex_entries.diamondpearlplatinum: It digs into the ground with its tail and makes a mazelike nest. It can fly just a little.
pokedex_entries.heartgold: When spotted, this Pokémon escapes backward by furiously boring into the ground with its tail.
pokedex_entries.soulsilver: If spotted, it escapes by burrowing with its tail. It can float just slightly using its wings.

pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It travels by digging through the ground. Diglett and Dunsparce share one another’s tunnels happily.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: When it sees a person, it digs a hole with its tail to make its escape. If you happen to find one, consider yourself lucky.
pokedex_entries.sword: This Pokémon’s tiny wings have some scientists saying that Dunsparce used to fly through the sky in ancient times.
pokedex_entries.shield: The nests Dunsparce live in are mazes of tunnels. They never get lost in their own nests—they can tell where they are by the scent of the dirt.

pokedex_entries.violet: If spotted, it escapes by burrowing with its tail. It can float just slightly using its wings.

pokedex_entries.gold: It rotates its arms to generate electricity, but it tires easily, so it charges up only a little bit.
pokedex_entries.silver: Even in the most vicious storm, this POKéMON plays happily if thunder rumbles in the sky.
pokedex_entries.crystal: It loves violent thunder. The space between its horns flickers bluish-white when it is charging energy.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: ELEKID stores electricity in its body. If it touches metal and accidentally discharges all its built-up electricity, this POKéMON begins swinging its arms in circles to recharge itself.
pokedex_entries.firered: Even in the most vicious storm, this POKéMON plays happily if thunder rumbles in the sky.
pokedex_entries.leafgreen: It rotates its arms to generate electricity, but it tires easily, so it charges up only a little bit.
pokedex_entries.emerald: If it touches metal and discharges the electricity it has stored in its body, an ELEKID begins swinging its arms in circles to recharge itself.
pokedex_entries.diamondpearl: It generates electricity by whirling its arms. However, it can’t store the energy it makes.
pokedex_entries.platinum: A weak electric current flows between its horns. Sticking a hand there shocks the unwary.
pokedex_entries.heartgold: It rotates its arms to generate electricity, but it tires easily, so it only charges up a little bit.
pokedex_entries.soulsilver: Even in the most vicious storm, this Pokémon plays happily if thunder rumbles in the sky.
pokedex_entries.blackwhite: A weak electric current flows between its horns. Sticking a hand there shocks the unwary.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Spinning its arms around to generate electricity makes the area between its horns shine light blue.
pokedex_entries.x: It generates electricity by whirling its arms. However, it can’t store the energy it makes.
pokedex_entries.y: Spinning its arms around to generate electricity makes the area between its horns shine light blue.
pokedex_entries.omega_rubyalpha_sapphire: Elekid stores electricity in its body. If it touches metal and accidentally discharges all its built-up electricity, this Pokémon begins swinging its arms in circles to recharge itself.
pokedex_entries.sun: When it’s in a house, electrical outlets serve as its baby bottles. It sucks down electricity.
pokedex_entries.moon: This Pokémon is constantly fighting with Togedemaru that try to steal its electricity. It’s a pretty even match.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: When it hears the crash of thunder, Elekid’s mood improves. It can be useful to record that sound and play it when Elekid’s feeling down.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: When its horns shine a bluish white, that’s the sign it’s fully charged. You’ll get a shocking jolt if you touch it!
pokedex_entries.sword: When a storm approaches, this Pokémon gets restless. Once Elekid hears the sound of thunder, it gets full-on rowdy.
pokedex_entries.shield: It’s not good at storing electricity yet. This Pokémon sneaks into people’s homes, looking for electrical outlets to eat electricity from.
pokedex_entries.brilliant_diamondshining_pearl: It generates electricity by whirling its arms. However, it can’t store the energy it makes.
pokedex_entries.legends:_arceus: They generate electricity by spinning their arms. During a thunderstorm, if one hears the lively voices of children out in the wilderness, what one is actually hearing are the voices of Elekid.

pokedex_entries.silver: A POKéMON that races across the land. It is said that one is born every time a new volcano appears.
pokedex_entries.crystal: This brawny POKéMON courses around the earth, spouting flames hotter than a volcano’s magma.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: ENTEI embodies the passion of magma. This POKéMON is thought to have been born in the eruption of a volcano. It sends up massive bursts of fire that utterly consume all that they touch.

pokedex_entries.gold: It uses the fine hair that covers its body to sense air currents and predict its enemy’s actions.
pokedex_entries.silver: By reading air currents, it can predict things such as the weather or its foe’s next move.
pokedex_entries.crystal: The tip of its forked tail quivers when it is predicting its opponent’s next move.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: ESPEON is extremely loyal to any TRAINER it considers to be worthy. It is said that this POKéMON developed its precognitive powers to protect its TRAINER from harm.
pokedex_entries.firered: By reading air currents, it can predict things such as the weather or its foe’s next move.
pokedex_entries.leafgreen: It uses the fine hair that covers its body to sense air currents and predict its enemy’s actions.
pokedex_entries.emerald: An ESPEON is extremely loyal to any TRAINER it considers to be worthy. It is said to have developed precognitive powers to protect its TRAINER from harm.
pokedex_entries.diamondpearl: Its fur has the look and feel of velvet. The orb on its forehead glows when it uses psycho-power.
pokedex_entries.platinum: Its fur is so sensitive, it can sense minute shifts in the air and predict the weather.
pokedex_entries.heartgold: It uses the fine hair that covers its body to sense air currents and predict its enemy’s actions.

pokedex_entries.moon: It unleashes psychic power from the orb on its forehead. When its power is exhausted, the orb grows dull and dark.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Although it originally had no powers at all, people say its precognitive faculties were awakened by its need to protect itself.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Psychic power builds up in the orb on its forehead as it bathes in the sunshine. Espeon is not good at battling at night.

pokedex_entries.legends:_arceus: Wields an arcane power with which it can predict the weather and even people’s thoughts. When bathed in sunshine, the scarlet orb on its brow glows and builds energy.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: The tip of its forked tail quivers when it is predicting its opponent’s next move.
pokedex_entries.violet: It uses the fine hair that covers its body to sense air currents and predict its enemy’s actions.

pokedex_entries.silver: It is hard for it to support its own weight out of water, so it gets down on all fours. But it moves fast.
pokedex_entries.crystal: Although it has a massive body, its powerful hind legs enable it to move quickly, even on the ground.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: FERALIGATR intimidates its foes by opening its huge mouth. In battle, it will kick the ground hard with its thick and powerful hind legs to charge at the foe at an incredible speed.

pokedex_entries.leafgreen: When it bites with its massive and powerful jaws, it shakes its head and savagely tears up its victim.
pokedex_entries.emerald: It opens its huge mouth to intimidate enemies. In battle, it runs using its thick and powerful hind legs to charge the foe with incredible speed.
pokedex_entries.diamondpearlplatinum: It usually moves slowly, but it goes at blinding speed when it attacks and bites prey.

pokedex_entries.gold: As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool won’t grow.
pokedex_entries.silver: Its fluffy fleece easily stores electricity. Its rubbery hide keeps it from being electrocuted.
pokedex_entries.crystal: Because of its rubbery, electricity-resistant skin, it can store lots of electricity in its fur.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: FLAAFFY’s wool quality changes so that it can generate a high amount of static electricity with a small amount of wool. The bare and slick parts of its hide are shielded against electricity.
pokedex_entries.firered: Its fluffy fleece easily stores electricity. Its rubbery hide keeps it from being electrocuted.
pokedex_entries.leafgreen: As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool won’t grow.
pokedex_entries.emerald: Its fleece quality changes to generate strong static electricity with a small amount of wool. The bare, slick parts of its hide are shielded against electricity.
pokedex_entries.diamondpearlplatinum: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.
pokedex_entries.heartgold: As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool won’t grow.
pokedex_entries.soulsilver: Its fluffy fleece easily stores electricity. Its rubbery hide keeps it from being electrocuted.

pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Not even downy wool will grow on its rubbery, nonconductive patches of skin that prevent electrical shock.

pokedex_entries.y: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.

pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It stores electricity in its fluffy fleece. If it stores up too much, it will start to go bald in those patches.

pokedex_entries.scarlet: As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool won’t grow.
pokedex_entries.violet: Because of its rubbery, electricity-resistant skin, it can store lots of electricity in its fur.

pokedex_entries.gold: Its entire body is shielded by a steel-hard shell. What lurks inside the armor is a total mystery.
pokedex_entries.silver: It remains immovably rooted to its tree. It scatters pieces of its hard shell to drive its enemies away.
pokedex_entries.crystal: Usually found hanging on to a fat tree trunk. It shoots out bits of its shell when it sees action.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: FORRETRESS conceals itself inside its hardened steel shell. The shell is opened when the POKéMON is catching prey, but it does so at such a quick pace that the shell’s inside cannot be seen.
pokedex_entries.firered: It remains immovably rooted to its tree. It scatters pieces of its hard shell to drive its enemies away.
pokedex_entries.leafgreen: Its entire body is shielded by a steel-hard shell. What lurks inside the armor is a total mystery.
pokedex_entries.emerald: It keeps itself inside its steel shell. The shell is opened when it is catching prey, but it is so quick that the shell’s inside cannot be seen.
pokedex_entries.diamondpearlplatinum: It is encased in a steel shell. Its peering eyes are all that can be seen of its mysterious innards.
pokedex_entries.heartgold: Its entire body is shielded by a steel-hard shell. What lurks inside this shell is a total mystery.
pokedex_entries.soulsilver: It remains immovably rooted to its tree. It scatters pieces of its hard shell to drive its enemies away.

pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: In the moment that it gulps down its prey, the inside of its shell is exposed, but to this day, no one has ever seen that sight.

pokedex_entries.gold: It makes a nest to suit its long and skinny body. The nest is impossible for other POKéMON to enter.
pokedex_entries.silver: There is no telling where the tail begins. Despite its short legs, it is quick at hunting RATTATA.
pokedex_entries.crystal: It lives in narrow burrows that fit its slim body. The deeper the nests go, the more mazelike they become.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: FURRET has a very slim build. When under attack, it can slickly squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, this POKéMON is very nimble and fleet.

pokedex_entries.gold: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent and bite.
pokedex_entries.silver: Its tail, which also contains a small brain, may bite on its own if it notices an alluring smell.
pokedex_entries.crystal: When it is in danger, its tail uses some sort of mysterious powers to drive away the enemy.
pokedex_entries.ruby: GIRAFARIG’s rear head also has a brain, but it is small. The rear head attacks in response to smells and sounds. Approaching this POKéMON from behind can cause the rear head to suddenly lash out and bite.
pokedex_entries.sapphire: GIRAFARIG’s rear head contains a tiny brain that is too small for thinking. However, the rear head doesn’t need to sleep, so it can keep watch over its surroundings 24 hours a day.
pokedex_entries.firered: Its tail, which also contains a small brain, may bite on its own if it notices an alluring smell.
pokedex_entries.leafgreen: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent and bite.
pokedex_entries.emerald: A GIRAFARIG is an herbivore--it eats grass and tree shoots. While it is eating, its tail makes chewing and swallowing motions as if it were also eating.
pokedex_entries.diamond: Its tail also has a small brain. It bites to repel any foe trying to sneak up on it from behind.
pokedex_entries.pearl: While it sleeps, the head on its tail keeps watch. The tail doesn’t need to sleep.
pokedex_entries.platinum: The head on its tail contains a small brain. It can instinctively fight even while facing backward.
pokedex_entries.heartgold: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent by biting.
pokedex_entries.soulsilver: Its tail, which also contains a small brain, may bite on its own if it notices an alluring smell.

pokedex_entries.brilliant_diamond: Its tail has a separate small brain. The tail bites to repel any foe trying to sneak up on the Pokémon from behind.
pokedex_entries.shining_pearl: While it sleeps, the head on its tail keeps watch. The tail doesn’t need to sleep.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Though very small, the brain in its tail is still considered an important organ because it emits powerful psychic energy.
pokedex_entries.violet: Girafarig’s tail has a small head. It instinctively bites at any foe that approaches the Pokémon from behind.

pokedex_entries.gold: It flies straight at its target’s face then clamps down on the startled victim to inject poison.
pokedex_entries.silver: It usually clings to cliffs. When it spots its prey, it spreads its wings and glides down to attack.
pokedex_entries.crystal: It builds its nest on a steep cliff. When it is done gliding, it hops along the ground back to its nest.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: GLIGAR glides through the air without a sound as if it were sliding. This POKéMON hangs on to the face of its foe using its clawed hind legs and the large pincers on its forelegs, then injects the prey with its poison barb.
pokedex_entries.firered: It usually clings to cliffs. When it spots its prey, it spreads its wings and glides down to attack.
pokedex_entries.leafgreen: It flies straight at its target’s face, then clamps down on the startled victim to inject poison.
pokedex_entries.emerald: It glides without making a single sound. It grasps the face of its foe using its hind and large front claws, then stabs with its poison barb.
pokedex_entries.diamondpearl: It sails on the winds with its limbs extended to strike from the sky. It aims for the prey’s face.
pokedex_entries.platinum: It glides as if sliding. It startles foes by clamping on to their faces, then jabs with its poison stinger.
pokedex_entries.heartgold: It flies straight at its target’s face, then clamps down on the startled victim to inject poison.

pokedex_entries.blackwhite: It glides as if sliding. It startles foes by clamping on to their faces, then jabs with its poison stinger.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: It clamps on to its chosen prey then jabs the stinger on its tail into the prey while it’s stunned with surprise.
pokedex_entries.x: It usually clings to cliffs. When it spots its prey, it spreads its wings and glides down to attack.
pokedex_entries.y: It flies straight at its target’s face, then clamps down on the startled victim to inject poison.

pokedex_entries.brilliant_diamondshining_pearl: It sails on the winds with its limbs extended to strike from the sky. It aims for the prey’s face.
pokedex_entries.legends:_arceus: Its tail is tipped by a thick, horrible stinger. To bring down prey, it will first obscure their vision by covering their faces with its body, and then it will use the stinger to inject them with venom.

pokedex_entries.gold: It is actually timid and easily spooked. If attacked, it flails about to fend off its attacker.
pokedex_entries.silver: Because its fangs are too heavy, it always keeps its head tilted down. However, its BITE is powerful.
pokedex_entries.crystal: It can make most any POKéMON run away simply by opening its mouth wide to reveal its big fangs.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: GRANBULL has a particularly well-developed lower jaw. The enormous fangs are heavy, causing the POKéMON to tip its head back for balance. Unless it is startled, it will not try to bite indiscriminately.
pokedex_entries.firered: Because its fangs are too heavy, it always keeps its head tilted down. However, its BITE is powerful.

pokedex_entries.diamondpearlplatinum: It is timid in spite of its looks. If it becomes enraged, however, it will strike with its huge fangs.
pokedex_entries.heartgold: It is actually timid and easily spooked. If attacked, it flails about to fend off its attacker.

pokedex_entries.moon: More timid than Snubbull, this Pokémon is doted on by young people amused at the contrast between its looks and its attitude.

pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Although it’s popular with young people, Granbull is timid and sensitive, so it’s totally incompetent as a watchdog.

pokedex_entries.gold: This powerful POKéMON thrusts its prized horn under its enemies’ bellies then lifts and throws them.
pokedex_entries.silver: Usually docile, but if disturbed while sipping honey, it chases off the intruder with its horn.
pokedex_entries.crystal: With its Herculean powers, it can easily throw around an object that is 100 times its own weight.
pokedex_entries.ruby: HERACROSS charges in a straight line at its foe, slips beneath the foe’s grasp, and then scoops up and hurls the opponent with its mighty horn. This POKéMON even has enough power to topple a massive tree.
pokedex_entries.sapphire: HERACROSS has sharp claws on its feet. These are planted firmly into the ground or the bark of a tree, giving the POKéMON a secure and solid footing to forcefully fling away foes with its proud horn.
pokedex_entries.firered: Usually docile, but if disturbed while sipping honey, it chases off the intruder with its horn.
pokedex_entries.leafgreen: This powerful POKéMON thrusts its prized horn under its enemies’ bellies, then lifts and throws them.
pokedex_entries.emerald: They gather in forests seeking the sweet sap of trees. It is completely clad in a steel-hard shell. It is proud of its horn, which it uses to fling foes.
pokedex_entries.diamond: It gathers in forests to search for tree sap, its favorite food. It’s strong enough to hurl foes.
pokedex_entries.pearl: With powerful legs and claws, it generates enough power to hurl foes over great distances.
pokedex_entries.platinum: It loves sweet honey. To keep all the honey to itself, it hurls rivals away with its prized horn.
pokedex_entries.heartgold: This powerful Pokémon thrusts its prized horn under its enemies’ bellies, then lifts and throws them.
pokedex_entries.soulsilver: It is usually docile, but if it is disturbed while sipping honey, it chases off the intruder with its horn.
pokedex_entries.blackwhite: It loves sweet honey. To keep all the honey to itself, it hurls rivals away with its prized horn.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: No matter how heavy its opponents, it flings them far away with its prized horn.
pokedex_entries.x: This powerful Pokémon thrusts its prized horn under its enemies’ bellies, then lifts and throws them.
pokedex_entries.y: With its Herculean powers, it can easily throw around an object that is 100 times its own weight.
pokedex_entries.omega_ruby: Heracross charges in a straight line at its foe, slips beneath the foe’s grasp, and then scoops up and hurls the opponent with its mighty horn. This Pokémon even has enough power to topple a massive tree.
pokedex_entries.alpha_sapphire: Heracross has sharp claws on its feet. These are planted firmly into the ground or the bark of a tree, giving the Pokémon a secure and solid footing to forcefully fling away foes with its proud horn.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It’s proud of its thick horn. In Alola, its biggest rival is Vikavolt, which it’s always fighting with.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It roams through forests searching for sweet nectar. Although it boasts fantastic physical strength, it’s not that good at flying.
pokedex_entries.sword: Heracross loves sweet sap and will go looking through forests for it. The Pokémon uses its two antennae to pick up scents as it searches.
pokedex_entries.shield: This Pokémon takes pride in its strength, which allows it to lift things 100 times heavier than itself with no trouble at all.
pokedex_entries.brilliant_diamond: It gathers in forests to search for tree sap, its favorite food. It’s strong enough to hurl foes.
pokedex_entries.shining_pearl: Its powerful legs and claws give it enough power to hurl foes over great distances.
pokedex_entries.legends:_arceus: This Pokémon has an unparalleled horn. Heracross itself demonstrates tremendous power—it’s capable of throwing several people trained in the traditional arts of war at once.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: It loves sweet nectar. To keep all the nectar to itself, it hurls rivals away with its prized horn.
pokedex_entries.violet: With its herculean powers, it can easily throw around an object that is 100 times its own weight.

pokedex_entries.gold: The light it emits is so bright that it can illuminate the sea’s surface from a depth of over three miles.
pokedex_entries.silver: It blinds prey with an intense burst of light, then swallows the immobilized prey in a single gulp.
pokedex_entries.crystal: This POKéMON uses the bright part of its body, which changed from a dorsal fin, to lure prey.
pokedex_entries.ruby: LANTURN is nicknamed “the deep-sea star” for its illuminated antenna. This POKéMON produces light by causing a chemical reaction between bacteria and its bodily fluids inside the antenna.
pokedex_entries.sapphire: LANTURN is known to emit light. If you peer down into the dark sea from a ship at night, you can sometimes see this POKéMON’s light rising from the depths where it swims. It gives the sea an appearance of a starlit night.
pokedex_entries.firered: It blinds prey with an intense burst of light, then swallows the immobilized prey in a single gulp.
pokedex_entries.leafgreen: The light it emits is so bright that it can illuminate the sea’s surface from a depth of over three miles.
pokedex_entries.emerald: The light-emitting orbs on its back are very bright. They are formed from a part of its dorsal fin. This POKéMON illuminates the inky darkness of deep seas.
pokedex_entries.diamondpearlplatinum: LANTURN’s light can shine up from great depths. It is nicknamed “The Deep-Sea Star.”
pokedex_entries.heartgold: The light it emits is so bright that it can illuminate the sea’s surface from a depth of over three miles.
pokedex_entries.soulsilver: It blinds prey with an intense burst of light. With the prey incapacitated, the Pokémon swallows it in a single gulp.

pokedex_entries.y: It blinds prey with an intense burst of light. With the prey incapacitated, the Pokémon swallows it in a single gulp.
pokedex_entries.omega_ruby: Lanturn is nicknamed “the deep-sea star” for its illuminated antenna. This Pokémon produces light by causing a chemical reaction between bacteria and its bodily fluids inside the antenna.
pokedex_entries.alpha_sapphire: Lanturn is known to emit light. If you peer down into the dark sea from a ship at night, you can sometimes see this Pokémon’s light rising from the depths where it swims. It gives the sea an appearance of a starlit night.
pokedex_entries.sun: Should you peer into the ocean at night and see a light shining like the stars, that is Lanturn.
pokedex_entries.moon: This Pokémon flashes a bright light that blinds its prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electrical attack.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: When the bacteria living inside its antennae absorb Lanturn’s bodily fluids, a strong luminescent effect is produced.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It lives far down in the depths of the ocean. It blinds its prey with light, using the moment they’re dazzled to swallow them whole.

pokedex_entries.gold: It feeds on soil. After it has eaten a large mountain, it will fall asleep so it can grow.
pokedex_entries.silver: It is born deep underground. It can’t emerge until it has entirely consumed the soil around it.
pokedex_entries.crystal: Born deep underground, this POKéMON becomes a pupa after eating enough dirt to make a mountain.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: LARVITAR is born deep under the ground. To come up to the surface, this POKéMON must eat its way through the soil above. Until it does so, LARVITAR cannot see its parent’s face.

pokedex_entries.gold: When the stars flicker in the night sky, it flutters about, scattering a glowing powder.
pokedex_entries.silver: The star patterns on its back grow larger or smaller depending on the number of stars in the night sky.
pokedex_entries.crystal: In the daytime when it gets warm, it curls up inside a big leaf and drifts off into a deep slumber.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: It is said that in lands with clean air, where the stars fill the sky, there live LEDIAN in countless numbers. There is a good reason for this - the POKéMON uses the light of the stars as its energy.
pokedex_entries.firered: The star patterns on its back grow larger or smaller depending on the number of stars in the night sky.
pokedex_entries.leafgreen: When the stars flicker in the night sky, it flutters about, scattering a glowing powder.
pokedex_entries.emerald: It is said that in lands with clean air, where the stars fill the sky, there live many LEDIAN. For good reason, they use the light of the stars as energy.
pokedex_entries.diamondpearlplatinum: It uses starlight as energy. When more stars appear at night, the patterns on its back grow larger.
pokedex_entries.heartgold: When the stars flicker in the night sky, it flutters about, scattering a glowing powder.
pokedex_entries.soulsilver: The spot patterns on its back grow larger or smaller depending on the number of stars in the night sky.
pokedex_entries.blackwhiteblack_2white_2: It uses starlight as energy. When more stars appear at night, the patterns on its back grow larger.
pokedex_entries.x: When the stars flicker in the night sky, it flutters about, scattering a glowing powder.
pokedex_entries.y: The spot patterns on its back grow larger or smaller depending on the number of stars in the night sky.
pokedex_entries.omega_rubyalpha_sapphire: It is said that in lands with clean air, where the stars fill the sky, there live Ledian in countless numbers. There is a good reason for this—the Pokémon uses the light of the stars as its energy.
pokedex_entries.sun: While it’s believed that starlight provides it with energy, this Pokémon also loves to eat berries. In the daytime, it curls up in the grass to sleep.
pokedex_entries.moon: In battle, it throws punches with all four arms. The power of each individual blow is piddly, so it aims to win by quantity rather than quality.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It’s said that the patterns on its back are related to the stars in the night sky, but the details of that relationship remain unclear.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It flies through the night sky, sprinkling sparkly dust. According to some, if that dust sticks to you, good things will happen to you.
pokedex_entries.brilliant_diamondshining_pearl: It uses starlight as energy. When more stars appear at night, the patterns on its back grow larger.

pokedex_entries.gold: It is very timid. It will be afraid to move if it is alone. But it will be active if it is in a group.
pokedex_entries.silver: When the weather turns cold, lots of LEDYBA gather from everywhere to cluster and keep each other warm.
pokedex_entries.crystal: It is timid and clusters together with others. The fluid secreted by its feet indicates its location.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: LEDYBA secretes an aromatic fluid from where its legs join its body. This fluid is used for communicating with others. This POKéMON conveys its feelings to others by altering the fluid’s scent.
pokedex_entries.firered: When the weather turns cold, numerous LEDYBA gather from everywhere to cluster and keep each other warm.
pokedex_entries.leafgreen: It is very timid. It will be afraid to move if it is alone. But it will be active if it is in a group.
pokedex_entries.emerald: LEDYBA communicate using a fluid that they secrete from where the legs join the body. They are said to convey feelings to others by altering the fluid’s scent.
pokedex_entries.diamondpearlplatinum: It is so timid, it can’t move if it isn’t with a swarm of others. It conveys its feelings with scent.
pokedex_entries.heartgold: It is very timid. It will be afraid to move if it is alone. But it will be active if it is in a group.
pokedex_entries.soulsilver: When the weather turns cold, lots of LEDYBA gather from everywhere to cluster and keep each other warm.

pokedex_entries.y: It is timid and clusters together with others. The fluid secreted by its feet indicates its location.
pokedex_entries.omega_rubyalpha_sapphire: Ledyba secretes an aromatic fluid from where its legs join its body. This fluid is used for communicating with others. This Pokémon conveys its feelings to others by altering the fluid’s scent.
pokedex_entries.sun: They are timid and grow uneasy when not in a swarm with others of their kind. The pattern on their backs differs slightly from one to another.
pokedex_entries.moon: They communicate with one another using bodily fluids that give off odors. When they’re angry, their odor smells sour.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: This Pokémon is very sensitive to cold. In the warmth of Alola, it appears quite lively.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: These very cowardly Pokémon join together and use Reflect to protect their nest.
pokedex_entries.brilliant_diamondshining_pearl: It’s so timid that it can’t move unless it’s with a swarm. It conveys its feelings through scent.

pokedex_entries.silver: It is said to be the guardian of the seas. It is rumored to have been seen on the night of a storm.
pokedex_entries.crystal: It has an incredible ability to calm raging storms. It is said that LUGIA appears when storms start.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: LUGIA’s wings pack devastating power - a light fluttering of its wings can blow apart regular houses. As a result, this POKéMON chooses to live out of sight deep under the sea.

pokedex_entries.gold: Each and every time it inhales and exhales, hot embers dribble out of its mouth and nostrils.
pokedex_entries.silver: It is found in volcanic craters. Its body temp. is over 1100 degrees, so don’t underestimate it.
pokedex_entries.crystal: It naturally spits an 1100-degree flame. It is said when many appear, it heralds a volcanic eruption.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: MAGBY’s state of health is determined by observing the fire it breathes. If the POKéMON is spouting yellow flames from its mouth, it is in good health. When it is fatigued, black smoke will be mixed in with the flames.
pokedex_entries.firered: It is found in volcanic craters. Its body heat exceeds 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit, so don’t underestimate it.
pokedex_entries.leafgreen: Each and every time it inhales and exhales, hot embers dribble out of its mouth and nostrils.
pokedex_entries.emerald: If a MAGBY is spouting yellow flames from its mouth, it is in good health. When it is fatigued, black smoke will be mixed in with the flames.
pokedex_entries.diamondpearl: Its body temperature is around 1,100 degrees F. It is healthy if it is breathing yellow flames.
pokedex_entries.platinum: Its magma-like blood circulates throughout its body. Its body’s heat can top 1,100 degrees F.
pokedex_entries.heartgold: Each and every time it inhales and exhales, hot embers dribble from its mouth and nostrils.
pokedex_entries.soulsilver: It is found in volcanic craters. Its body temperature is over 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit, so don’t underestimate it.
pokedex_entries.blackwhite: Its magma-like blood circulates throughout its body. Its body’s heat can top 1,100 degrees F.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: It’s small, but its body temperature is over 1,100 degrees F. Embers escape its mouth and nose when it breathes.
pokedex_entries.x: It’s small, but its body temperature is over 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit. Embers escape its mouth and nose when it breathes.
pokedex_entries.y: Its magma-like blood circulates throughout its body. Its body’s heat can top 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.omega_rubyalpha_sapphire: Magby’s state of health is determined by observing the fire it breathes. If the Pokémon is spouting yellow flames from its mouth, it is in good health. When it is fatigued, black smoke will be mixed in with the flames.
pokedex_entries.sun: Many of these Pokémon can be seen in areas with volcanic activity. Feeding can get them so excited, they exhale flames of 1,100 degrees F.
pokedex_entries.moon: A famous potter lives with a Magby. Apparently its soft flames produce fine works.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: When flames drip from its nose, that means it has a cold. Have it lie down for a nice rest in some magma.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Its body temperature is always around 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit. If Magby falls into a small- enough pond, the whole thing will dry up.
pokedex_entries.sword: This Pokémon is still small and timid. Whenever Magby gets excited or surprised, flames leak from its mouth and its nose.
pokedex_entries.shield: This Pokémon makes its home near volcanoes. At the end of the day, Magby soaks in magma, resting and recovering from the day’s fatigue.
pokedex_entries.brilliant_diamondshining_pearl: Its body temperature is around 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit. It is healthy if it is exhaling yellow flames.
pokedex_entries.legends:_arceus: This Pokémon lives in volcanic areas. With each breath, sparks spurt from its mouth and nose. When Magby is in good health, its flames gain a yellow tint.

pokedex_entries.gold: The shell on its back is just skin that has cooled and hardened. It breaks easily with a slight touch.
pokedex_entries.silver: Its brittle shell occasionally spouts intense flames that circulate throughout its body.
pokedex_entries.crystal: Its body is as hot as lava and is always billowing. Flames will occasionally burst from its shell.
pokedex_entries.ruby: MAGCARGO’s shell is actually its skin that hardened as a result of cooling. Its shell is very brittle and fragile - just touching it causes it to crumble apart. This POKéMON returns to its original size by dipping itself in magma.
pokedex_entries.sapphire: MAGCARGO’s body temperature is approximately 18,000 degrees F. Water is vaporized on contact. If this POKéMON is caught in the rain, the raindrops instantly turn into steam, cloaking the area in a thick fog.
pokedex_entries.firered: Its brittle shell occasionally spouts intense flames that circulate throughout its body.
pokedex_entries.leafgreen: The shell on its back is just skin that has cooled and hardened. It breaks easily with a slight touch.
pokedex_entries.emerald: The shell on its back is made of hardened magma. Tens of thousands of years spent living in volcanic craters have turned MAGCARGO’s bodies into magma.
pokedex_entries.diamondpearlplatinum: Its body temperature is roughly 18,000 degrees F. Flames spout from gaps in its hardened shell.
pokedex_entries.heartgold: The shell on its back is just skin that has cooled and hardened. It breaks easily with a slight touch.

pokedex_entries.alpha_sapphire: Magcargo’s body temperature is approximately 18,000 degrees Fahrenheit. Water is vaporized on contact. If this Pokémon is caught in the rain, the raindrops instantly turn into steam, cloaking the area in a thick fog.
pokedex_entries.brilliant_diamondshining_pearl: Its body temperature is roughly 18,000 degrees Fahrenheit. Flames burst from gaps in its shell made of hardened magma.

pokedex_entries.gold: As it majestically swims, it doesn’t care if REMORAID attach to it for scavenging its leftovers.
pokedex_entries.silver: Swimming freely in open seas, it may fly out of the water and over the waves if it builds up enough speed.
pokedex_entries.crystal: It swims along freely, eating things that swim into its mouth. Its whole body is very coarse.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: On sunny days, schools of MANTINE can be seen elegantly leaping over the sea’s waves. This POKéMON is not bothered by the REMORAID that hitches rides.
pokedex_entries.firered: Swimming freely in open seas, it may fly out of the water and over the waves if it builds up enough speed.
pokedex_entries.leafgreen: As it majestically swims, it doesn’t care if REMORAID attach to it to scavenge for its leftovers.
pokedex_entries.emerald: On sunny days, schools of MANTINE can be seen elegantly leaping over the waves. It is not bothered by the REMORAID that hitches rides.
pokedex_entries.diamond: When the waves are calm, one may encounter a swarm of MANTINE swimming as if they are in flight.
pokedex_entries.pearl: It swims elegantly, mindless of REMORAID hitching on to its broad fins. It has a docile nature.
pokedex_entries.platinum: While elegantly swimming in the sea, it ignores REMORAID that cling to its fins seeking food scraps.

pokedex_entries.x: If it builds up enough speed swimming, it can fly over 300 feet out of the water from the surface of the ocean.
pokedex_entries.y: While elegantly swimming in the sea, it ignores Remoraid that cling to its fins seeking food scraps.
pokedex_entries.omega_rubyalpha_sapphire: On sunny days, schools of Mantine can be seen elegantly leaping over the sea’s waves. This Pokémon is not bothered by the Remoraid that hitches rides.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Postcards and posters featuring Mantine leaping elegantly above the waves are popular souvenirs of Alola.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Many people have taken up surfing because they admire how magnificently Mantine swims.
pokedex_entries.sword: If it builds up enough speed swimming, it can jump out above the waves and glide for over 300 feet.
pokedex_entries.shield: As it majestically swims, it doesn’t care if Remoraid attach to it to scavenge for its leftovers.
pokedex_entries.brilliant_diamond: When the waves are calm, one may encounter a swarm of Mantine swimming as if they are in flight.
pokedex_entries.shining_pearl: It swims elegantly, mindless of Remoraid hitching onto its broad fins. It is naturally docile.
pokedex_entries.legends:_arceus: This calm and gentle Pokémon swims gracefully through the sea. After building speed, it can leap out of the water. It is often misidentified as a bird Pokémon due to this behavior.

pokedex_entries.gold: The tip of its tail, which contains oil that is lighter than water, lets it swim without drowning.
pokedex_entries.silver: The end of its tail serves as a buoy that keeps it from drowning, even in a vicious current.
pokedex_entries.crystal: The fur on its body naturally repels water. It can stay dry, even when it plays in the water.
pokedex_entries.ruby: MARILL’s oil-filled tail acts much like a life preserver. If you see just its tail bobbing on the water’s surface, it’s a sure indication that this POKéMON is diving beneath the water to feed on aquatic plants.
pokedex_entries.sapphire: When fishing for food at the edge of a fast-running stream, MARILL wraps its tail around the trunk of a tree. This POKéMON’s tail is flexible and configured to stretch.
pokedex_entries.firered: The end of its tail serves as a buoy that keeps it from drowning, even in a vicious current.
pokedex_entries.leafgreen: The tip of its tail, which contains oil that is lighter than water, lets it swim without drowning.
pokedex_entries.emerald: Its body is covered with water-repellent fur. Because of the fur, it can swim through water at high speed without being slowed by the water’s resistance.
pokedex_entries.diamond: Using its tail as a float, it dives underwater. It likes eating plants that grow on river bottoms.
pokedex_entries.pearl: The tip of its tail is filled with oil that is lighter than water, so it acts as a float.
pokedex_entries.platinum: The oil-filled end of its tail floats on water. It keeps MARILL from drowning even in a strong current.

pokedex_entries.alpha_sapphire: When fishing for food at the edge of a fast-running stream, Marill wraps its tail around the trunk of a tree. This Pokémon’s tail is flexible and configured to stretch.
pokedex_entries.sword: This Pokémon uses its round tail as a float. The ball of Marill’s tail is filled with nutrients that have been turned into an oil.
pokedex_entries.shield: Even after Marill swims in a cold sea, its water- repellent fur dries almost as soon as Marill leaves the water. That’s why this Pokémon is never cold.
pokedex_entries.brilliant_diamond: Using its tail as a float, it dives underwater. It likes eating plants that grow in riverbeds.

pokedex_entries.violet: The oil-filled tail functions as a buoy, so it’s fine even in rivers with strong currents.

pokedex_entries.silver: MEGANIUM’s breath has the power to revive dead grass and plants. It can make them healthy again.
pokedex_entries.crystal: Anyone who stands beside it becomes refreshed, just as if they were relaxing in a sunny forest.

pokedex_entries.gold: Its milk is packed with nutrition, making it the ultimate beverage for the sick or weary.
pokedex_entries.silver: If it has just had a baby, the milk it produces contains much more nutrition than usual.
pokedex_entries.crystal: In order to milk a MILTANK, one must have a knack for rhythmically pulling up and down on its udders.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: MILTANK gives over five gallons of milk on a daily basis. Its sweet milk is enjoyed by children and grown-ups alike. People who can’t drink milk turn it into yogurt and eat it instead.
pokedex_entries.firered: If it has just had a baby, the milk it produces contains much more nutrition than usual.
pokedex_entries.leafgreen: Its milk is packed with nutrition, making it the ultimate beverage for the sick or weary.
pokedex_entries.emerald: It gives over five gallons of milk daily. Its sweet milk is enjoyed by children and grown-ups alike. People who can’t drink milk turn it into yogurt and eat it instead.
pokedex_entries.diamondpearlplatinum: It is said that kids who drink MILTANK’s milk grow up to become hearty, healthy adults.
pokedex_entries.heartgold: Its milk is packed with nutrition, making it the ultimate beverage for the sick or weary.

pokedex_entries.blackwhiteblack_2white_2: It is said that kids who drink Miltank’s milk grow up to become hearty, healthy adults.

pokedex_entries.omega_rubyalpha_sapphire: Miltank gives over five gallons of milk on a daily basis. Its sweet milk is enjoyed by children and grown-ups alike. People who can’t drink milk turn it into yogurt and eat it instead.
pokedex_entries.sun: Its milk is high in calories and packed with nutrients. Therefore, if you drink too much of it, you may wind up with a body like Miltank’s.
pokedex_entries.moon: Most people raise it for its milk, but it’s quite tough and strong, so it’s also well suited for battle.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It produces over five gallons of milk a day. The higher the quality of the pastures it lives in, the richer and tastier its milk becomes.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Its milk is delicious and chock-full of nutrients. However, if you drink too much, it could make your stomach hurt, so be careful.
pokedex_entries.sword: Miltank produces highly nutritious milk, so it’s been supporting the lives of people and other Pokémon since ancient times.
pokedex_entries.shield: This Pokémon needs to be milked every day, or else it will fall ill. The flavor of Miltank milk changes with the seasons.
pokedex_entries.brilliant_diamondshining_pearl: It is said that kids who drink Miltank’s milk grow up to become hearty, healthy adults.

pokedex_entries.gold: It likes playing mischievous tricks such as screaming and wailing to startle people at night.
pokedex_entries.silver: It loves to bite and yank people’s hair from behind without warning, just to see their shocked reactions.
pokedex_entries.crystal: It loves to watch people it’s scared. It frightens them by screaming loudly or appearing suddenly.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: MISDREAVUS frightens people with a creepy, sobbing cry. The POKéMON apparently uses its red spheres to absorb the fearful feelings of foes and turn them into nutrition.
pokedex_entries.firered: It loves to bite and yank people’s hair from behind without warning, just to see their shocked reactions.
pokedex_entries.leafgreen: It likes playing mischievous tricks such as screaming and wailing to startle people at night.
pokedex_entries.emerald: A MISDREAVUS frightens people with a creepy, sobbing cry. It apparently uses its red spheres to absorb the fear of foes as its nutrition.
pokedex_entries.diamond: It loves to sneak up on people late at night, then startle them with its shrieklike cry.
pokedex_entries.pearl: It gets nourishment from fear that it absorbs into its red orbs. In daytime, it sleeps in darkness.
pokedex_entries.platinum: A Pokémon that startles people in the middle of the night. It gathers fear as its energy.
pokedex_entries.heartgold: It likes playing mischievous tricks, such as screaming and wailing to startle people at night.
pokedex_entries.soulsilver: It loves to bite and yank people’s hair from behind without warning, just to see their shocked reactions.
pokedex_entries.blackwhiteblack_2white_2: A Pokémon that startles people in the middle of the night. It gathers fear as its energy.

pokedex_entries.y: It likes playing mischievous tricks, such as screaming and wailing to startle people at night.
pokedex_entries.omega_rubyalpha_sapphire: Misdreavus frightens people with a creepy, sobbing cry. The Pokémon apparently uses its red spheres to absorb the fearful feelings of foes and turn them into nutrition.
pokedex_entries.sun: It will use any means necessary to frighten people and absorb their life energy. It practices constantly to hone its skill in causing fear.
pokedex_entries.moon: If you hear a sobbing sound emanating from a vacant room, it’s undoubtedly a bit of mischief from Misdreavus.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: What gives meaning to its life is surprising others. If you set your ear against the red orbs around its neck, you can hear shrieking.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: What makes it happy is imitating the voices of weeping people and scaring everyone. It doesn’t deal well with folks who aren’t easily frightened.
pokedex_entries.brilliant_diamond: It loves to sneak up on people late at night and startle them with its shrieking cry.
pokedex_entries.shining_pearl: It gets nourishment from fear that it absorbs into its red orbs. During the daytime, it sleeps in the shadows.
pokedex_entries.legends:_arceus: It conceals itself in darkness, sending chills up travelers’ spines with its childlike weeping. As it observes the frightened travelers with glee, the red orbs upon its chest let off an eerie light.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon startles people in the middle of the night. It gathers fear as its energy.
pokedex_entries.violet: It loves to bite and yank people’s hair from behind without warning, just to see their shocked reactions.

pokedex_entries.gold: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.
pokedex_entries.silver: It is said that when chased, it lures its attacker onto dark mountain trails where the foe will get lost.
pokedex_entries.crystal: It hides any shiny object it finds in a secret location. MURKROW and MEOWTH loot one another’s stashes.
pokedex_entries.rubysapphire: MURKROW was feared and loathed as the alleged bearer of ill fortune. This POKéMON shows strong interest in anything that sparkles or glitters. It will even try to steal rings from women.
pokedex_entries.firered: It is said that when chased, it lures its attacker onto dark mountain trails where the foe will get lost.

pokedex_entries.diamond: It is believed that seeing this Pokémon at night will bring about ominous occurrences.
pokedex_entries.pearl: It appears near travelers to lure them into deep forests. It is said to carry misfortune.
pokedex_entries.platinum: If spotted, it will lure an unwary person into chasing it, then lose the pursuer on mountain trails.
